title: Very Big Temple
review: This is very big temple with ample of parking available. You should not go on Hot day. Good place for picnic or photography. Overall must visit if you are in Ajmer

title: Amazingly Beautiful and Serene ~
review: This Jain temple is spread across huge area including hills. Temples over hills are under construction. RK Marble Temple is a world class architecture and has also got huge well maintained garden. People from all the religion visit to see this temple.

title: Magestic, peaceful and a must visit if you are in Pushkar
review: Nareli Jain Temple was a revelation. The temple compound is clean, with a nice collection of trees and flowers (excellent photo opportunities, if that interests you). The temple itself has intricate detailing both outside and inside the temple. No camera is allowed inside, the roof of the temple is what caught my eye, beautiful work.

title: Narely Jain Teerth
review: Narely famous for ain Teerth Temples located between Kishangarh & Ajmer By pass road Near Badliya Village surrounded by Aravali Hills gives a scenic view Worth Visiting

title: Ajmer
review: Visited this temple in evening on outskirts of Ajmer. Temple has amazing architecture and design with lot of excellent stone works. Was amazed .

title: Great architecture
review: The Nareli Jain temple is located on the National highway near Nasirabad Cantonment. I visited this amazing complex last August with my cousin Praveen and his son Sharan. The temple is extremely clean and is located away from the city. There are some amazing sculptures here. The main temple uses a mixture of styles and there are 23 miniature temples up the hill. You can drive nearly to the top and can get amazing views of the surroundings. We managed to catch a Sunset from the hill. There is an air of peace and tranquility here. A must see attraction near Ajmer.

title: Amazing Architecture
review: Nareli Temple is in the outskirts of Ajmer. Its a Jain Temple which is having a beautiful architecture and fabulous stone work.

title: Amazing location, fine architecture and ideal meditation temple
review: Holy Mahavira temple, build with great landscape, excellent parking space, peaceful location and ventilation marvel. The temple i found is best of the place to visit in Ajmer. Lord Mahavir sitting in meditation mudra, he simply blesses you to mediate.

title: Another interesting Jain temple
review: We passed this temple on our drive to Jaipur. It is certainly a very impressive structure especially the parts on top of the hill.

title: The site is still under construction
review: I have being here in May 2018. The site is under construction so you will not find any one inside the sanctum. I am sure when this is completed, it will look magnificent. But nobody has a visibility of when the whole temple will be completed.

title: Off route from Ajmer Pushkar but worth it
review: The place is on the Jaipur Ajmer National highway on the other end of Ajmer bypass.

title: Good Architectural Jain temple
review: Temple Architecture is nice.

title: Jai Jinendra
review: Holy palace.

title: I loved it.
review: Some places left good impressions on your mind this place is one of that. Very nice architecture. Situated at the foothills with background of mountains. Calm surrounding is the cherry on the top. Must visit place if you are in Ajmer or even passing by from Ajmer.

title: nareli jain temple
review: awesome place to visit and the architecture of the building is too good and you visit there with your family and friends even it is great attraction among tourist

title: Elegant architecture and serenity !
review: At the foothills of the Aravali hills are located the renowned jain temples with exquisite architecture and elegance... the neatly crafted structure is a monumental dedication , comprising multiple temples to the tirthankars or successive saints of the jain religion..the gradually cl7mbing structure reaches right up to the hill top...which is a work of great patience and dedication...sculptured over more than a decade...yes..it is a place worth visiting ...particularly between the months of October to February and occasionally during the monsoon season...say ..15th July to 30th August..

title: Beautiful architecture
review: I have visit this Jain temple in morning. Architecture of this temple was really great. Must visit it. Good place to visit with family.

title: Spectacular jain temple near Ajmer
review: On main highway near to Ajmer on Jaipur Jodhpur/Udaipur route it’s a great place to worship with lots of facilities specially for Jain people and jain food with comfortable stay. Big cow shelter is already there and few more temples are under construction. Darshan of 1008 shri munisuvrat nath teerthankar statue is miraculous

title: Very nice location and the lord statue
review: It is on main jaipur ajmer expressway and surrounded by the aravali hills.

title: The beauty of the Jain Architecture !
review: This temple is relatively new but it is a place one can feel the bliss and the calm as you enter .The beauty of the temple will touch you deep  with in. The main deity is the Jain Teerthakar and the work in the shrine casts a spell . There is no priests who will demand money here . No dress code but , one needs to avoid shorts . The best experience of being here is the sense of serenity enveloping you . Must place to visit .

title: Really nice but still under construction
review: Its a fantastic location, scale and purpose. The overall complex is awe inspiring. Its still under construction in parts and personally I can't wait till it gets completed! Its a pleasant and enriching experience.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: I went to Nareli Jain Temple. It is getting popular amongst the tourist for its beautiful architecture and intricate stone carvings which gives both traditional and contemporary look. It is great place to go.

title: clean ,beautiful and well maintained
review: one of the best place in ajmer to visit..located in the outskirt of ajmer this temple is peaceful place to search god.

title: Grt temple under construction.
review: Very ideally located bang on highway. Faster  comfortable approach from jaipur. Helipad nearbuy.arrangements r get. Food at bhojanshala was satvik. Looking fwd to go when it's completely do e. Expecting a grt outcome.

title: Superb Architecture... Must Visit place
review: It is constructed beautifully. It was not officially open when we visited. It is very huge area.It is very peaceful, clean, with gardens, it is outside the city of Ajmer. But it is worth visiting and spending your time here..

title: Nice religious place, at the outskirts of ajmer
review: Nareli Jain temple is a nice and big temple of Mahavira. It is made up of pure marble, beautifully decorated with entrances, pillars, walls, and roofs. It has big statue of Mahavira in ground floor and first floor. Nearby 14 statues at the hill, can also be visted during day time.

title: Surprise visit to the Nareli Jain temple
review: I was not sure about it but my wife told me give a shot. The moment we land up there we were amazed with the way it has been built ..cleaniless ..awesome crowd and a peace ful place.

title: Religious
review: This is also very old times jain temple nice to be there. Surrounding environment also filled with good and positive energy.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: I went to Nareli Jain Temple. Nareli Jain Temple is a sacred Tirtha of Digambar Jains in the suburban area of Ajmer. It is getting popular amongst the tourist for its beautiful architecture and intricate stone carvings which gives both traditional and contemporary look. It is great place to go.

title: Serene - Must Visit Digamber Jain Religious Place !!
review: Its located on NH 8. Its a huge spread place being built as Gyanoday Teerth Kshetra for Digamber Jain's. However, anyone can go and visit. One may need their own vehicle to reach this place as this is outside Ajmer City.

title: Nice temple
review: Gyanodaya tirth Jain temple nareli is big jain temple. Just type of great sammed shikhar ji jain temple. In this temple a big statue of god mahaveer swami.

title: Beautifu Archetcture design.
review: A Good place for Ajmerites with Beautifully designed architecture and worth visiting for anyone comming to Ajmer.

title: Peaceful & Beautiful
review: This is one temple of its architecture combined with spirituality. Outside of the temple is very nice with a view of 24 small temples for Teerthankaras in the background.

title: For Spending an hour
review: you can spend a good hour and take lots of picture as this place is very beautiful surrounded by hills

title: Nothing Much To Do
review: It is a Place only for Worship. Not attractive and nothing interesting. Only a Famous Jain Temple. Avoid if you are not a Jain.

title: Good
review: Good to stay very silent environment very well known and very well planned and clean worth visiting visit regularly.

title: Pure bliss
review: This was not in the top 5 list of us in Ajmer due to time constraints, but we are really fortunate we went there. The place is at outskirts of Ajmer and they have utilized the place quite well. one of the most photogenic location in Ajmer.

title: Peaceful and serene.
review: It's a place where you can find complete bliss amidst nature. The temple is newly built with a huge Jain Deity statue which gives you inner calm. The place offers a great view of the Aravali hills and also has row temples on a hill.

title: Great experience...
review: We friends visited here for first time because my friend suggested this jain temple. It is such a divine place. Design and Architecture of this temple is great.

title: WOW...Its Huge
review: Its a newly constructed jain temple on the outskirts of Ajmer. Visited this place recently and I completely blown away by the beauty of its architecture.

title: WoW Place
review: Must Visit...

title: Nareli Jain Temple
review: Temple is located outside Ajmer city. It was well maintained and very clean.  It's a very big place with awesome architecture. The main temple is of lord Mahaveer swami. There is a line of 24 temple. It was a nice jain temple. It is a nice picnic-spot also. If you are in Pushkar, don't miss it.

title: Can just have a view
review: The actual fun will be to go up the hill, unfortunate the temple people does not have the facility, while ola does not take u up.The place is good, clean, neat and good

title: Awesome
review: its a beautiful place to visit with family ! It's little far away from Ajmer city but you would enjoy time spend there and will take some pic for sure

title: Nice View
review: Jain temple, few portions still under construction, located on the highway outside the city, but definitely beautiful view from the top, I think you can see almost full Ajmer city from there. Not much time required to visit here, you can take your car to the top by road, better to visit during rains to enjoy the view!

title: Quiet & Peaceful
review: Although this temple has not yet been formally opened, perhaps that is the reason no puja etc is done. It is yet to be inaugurated. But I would say it was a very good experiance. We by chance stopped here while on the way to Ajmer from Kishangarh.

title: Good temple
review: It is a very beautiful temple it is situated in Ajmer it is known for beauty we found here cultural sign

title: Divine place
review: Been there with my family in June during our journey to Udaipur. Huge complex, well managed and maintained. Best part is the temple side on up hill. Good dining hall at the ground, serving veg food. Very reasonably priced and tasty. Little spicy for Non Rajasthani people. Simple and Jain food so be aware of eating timings. Its closes after sun set.

title: Mind in Peace
review: The Jain Temple is on the high way to back to Jaipur. A must visit place to gather peace in mind and to watch the beautiful architecture of the temple. Most of the people may be dont go there because when we go, no one was there besides us.

title: Splendid visit
review: This very majestic Jain temple dedicated to the Tirthankars of Jain religion ,is situated at the outskirts of Ajmer . Surprisingly ,once you enter the huge premises ,it doesn't feel like the normally space starved , a bit unkempt city . Very well maintained with plush green lawns and public amenities . The architecture of the temple is superb and I wonder how costly it would have been to erect a structure so grand . The statue of Mahavir in meditation mode is out of this world and very contemplative . Very serene and peaceful place . A must visit

title: Best jain temple
review: The best thing i liked about the temple is its Architecture .Light colored marble,occupies an area. Camera is not allowed to take photographs in main temple but we can take snaps in the surrounding of the temple. made of of marble and natural light is perfect cobination in the temple.

title: visit to ajmer and pushkar
review: Nareli Jain Temple is one of the beautiful place to visit and one must visit this beauiful architecural place while visiting the beautiful city of ajmer.

title: Join temple
review: Master piece of jain architecture with beautiful stones.  A great palace for feel peace no crowd there.

title: Beautiful jain temple
review: Nareli jain temple is beautiful jain temple .this jain temple is very popular in tourist.must see location.

title: Nice temple on Jaipur road
review: Its a jain temple situated on Jaipur highway road just outside ajmer, beautifully kept clean but a long walk takes you to the main temple where you can visit the largest tirthankara idol i have ever seen.

title: Very beautiful. Scenic location.
review: Beautiful work. Superb location. Decent jain food.

title: Newly built temple, with all the consequences
review: Oddly enough, but this temple in some ways reminded me of two temples in Israel. Outwardly it resembles the church of the Annunciation in Nazareth, but is inscribed into the  hilly landscape as Bahai temple in Haifa. With its own age the temple also looks like them  – it is very recent and barely crossed over the 20-year-old grade. Moreover, it is still not completely finished – some temples (there should be 24, and each is dedicated to one of Tirthankaras), of which it consists, are still in the construction stage. This is a newly built temple with all its attendant circumstances effects. You can feel it. The overall impression could be better. Although some samples of stone carving are good enough. In addition, inside the temple there are a huge metal idols of Tirthankara, each of which weighs over 20 tons and can be included into the list of heaviest metallic Jain idols all over the world.

title: Good architecture
review: Nice temple.If you have some extra time do visit since its on the highway.Not much crowd and easily accessable.

title: Worth a try.
review: Nareli Jain temple is a recently built  tourist attraction in Ajmer. It has a huge walkway, well maintained garden and good info on Jain religen. The main temple is on the ground level. Trip would be incomplete without going to hilltop. Need your own 4 wheeler to reach there. Best time to go is 9 to 11 am or 3 to 5 pm. Two hours should be good enough if you are on a day tour to Ajmer.

title: Nice Work ... nice Architecture !!
review: this place is full of peace as soon as you'll enter in the main Lobby there is Big Statue of Lord Buddha...this area is full of peace...silence...i really enjoyed...must visit !!

title: Mesmerizing Jain Digamber Temple
review: This a new Jain Digamber Temple - still parts of it are being developed. Whats finished is an awesome sight. Built on the bottom of the hill, where the main temple is built and had Lord Adshaver's idol. The temple hall is so peaceful and calm. Its must to see how old style sculpturing techniques are used today. Worth a visit.

title: beautiful place
review: A Very beautiful and peaceful place.

title: Beautiful  place
review: Very beautiful  place and clean just visit the place  kids enjoy very much and from ajmer go on ur vehicle  as the temple is on high way

title: Peaceful and beautiful : a must visit in Ajmer
review: Nareli Jain temple is around 9 km (east) away from Ajmer. The place is splendid and calm, offering opportunities for nice photographs. There is a giant Mahavira sculpture inside the temple. There is no entry fee, or restriction on photography. The place has descriptions about the Jain mythology and fables along its gardens. It is recommended to finish the visit in about an hour. Usually not crowded.

title: Beautiful and peacefull
review: It is one of the beautiful modern jain temples ....the place is huge and very divine...great place to feel peace ...jai jinendra

title: Peace everywhere
review: Had a lovely experience,garden is soothing,good place for young children as well as old age people..

title: Must visit
review: Very beautifully architecture of this temple. Very well crafted. It is one of the Modern Jain temple's. There are some beautiful statues also which describes something or the other. The gardens are very pretty and well maintained. The statue is very pretty and well crafted. Very peaceful and pleasant place.

title: Holy palace : Nareli jain temple
review: Nareli Jain temple, located on the outskirts of Ajmer, about 7km away, is a beautiful marble temple with angular and strikingly appealing designs.

title: Awesome place amidst Aravallis
review: Though my visit was in June 2016 amidst of so mucj heat, place was must watch.

title: a upcoming place
review: the new temples on the hill top are under construction and would be a good place to visit once complete. easy accessibility. the main temple at the bottom of the hill is a good place to visit. peaceful and enlighting.

title: A well maintained, peaceful, Jain pilgrimage
review: 7 kilometres away from hustle bustle of Ajmer city on Ajmer bypass, this beautiful site is atop a hill and well connected by road. You can hire a cab directly from railway station or can drive down from place of your stay. This is highly recommended place to visit for all secular tourists after Khwaja saheb dargaah visit. Place has well maintained and vastly sprawled green lawns and is known for striking symphony of contemporary and  traditional architect styles. Place is famous for intricate carvings on wall and pillars. Temple is ever sparkling in the best quality granite, marble and sandstone, which is found in abundance in Ajmer and Kekdi region. In the sanctum-sanctorum  portion , a very tall ashtdhatu idol of Bhagwan Mahavir swami is placed and worshipped by followers of Jain religion. Temple has a series of 24 temples atop the hill as a mark of offering prayers to 24 tirthankars and therefore place is called chaubisi i.e. hindi word for twenty four. For the same grounds, temple is also called 24 Jainalaya temple and road to it is called 24 Jainalya marg. Site  is frequently visited by  Digambar Jain sect followers.

title: Great Place
review: Visited this JAIN TEMPLE built on outskirts of Ajmer on Bearwar - Jaipur Highway is very well maintained and beautiful, Spend one night at the accommodation facility  run by trust, very neat & clean ROOMs with AC. all in all good place to visit

title: have great potential to be a tourist spot
review: it has potential but does not come across as if the management cares much about out of town visitors/tourists. Did not see a visitor's office. Maybe this place is for locals. It has a very big campus and the buildings are beautifully done in stone. But the arrangement for out of town/country tourists is lacking. Go but with a local person, and be ready to take off your shoes.

title: Awesome place
review: It is a very beautiful jain temple.. Lot of fun during visit..like heaven on earth..very big stechu of bhagwan Mahavir.. A big pool inside but not for swimming. Visit again definitely.

title: Recently built in heritage style
review: A pretty sight against the backdrop of Aravalli mountains. Very clean premises, Nareli teerth (pilgrimage place) as it is called is some 12 kilometers from Ajmer town and takes around 15 minutes to half hour from Ajmer. A full round of the entire heavily carved temple complex can be done in maximum one hour. The carving is beautiful. Artisans and sculptors of Rajasthan are generally good and patient carve out fine details. It is also a peaceful calm place and is maintained very well. To see the entire complex you need to climb stairs therefore it may be difficult for a wheelchair bound person to get a complete picture of the place.

title: Beautiful and peaceful temple
review: Very beautiful architecture..

title: nice
review: this nareli jain temple in ajmer , very nice & good looking . nareli temple inside atmosphere so good

title: A pilgrimage place for Jains that have come up recently
review: This is a massive temple with beautiful gardens and landscaping.  Ideal place for an evening outing with the family.  Lots of place for the kids to play around.  Twilight hour is very beautiful when the lights come up and on certain days the fountains work.  The statue of Lord Mahavira is huge and the temple is maintained well.  The replicas of places of worship of similar Jain Temples around the country are made atop the hill.

title: A great project
review: It is an ongoing jain project which has lot of temples and other facilities such as school hospital etc. location is very scenic and place is peaceful

title: Excellent place to visit
review: There are 24-25 temples built in honor of different Jain saints along a range on top of the Hill. The view from above is just inexplicable. The art and the culture expressed by this place is worthwhile to know.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: Outside Ajmer this temple is new building but very beautiful and neat and clean. Worth visiting place and spend few hours

title: Grand idol and temple
review: This temple has architectural similarities to Akshardham temple and is grand compound surrounded by Hills. The special feature of this temple is the main room(garbdgrah) which has grand statue of Jain Lord Rishabhnath in meditation. Meditating in front of this idol is a blissful experience.

title: very good place specially for Jain devotees
review: Nareli Jain Temple, is Jain temple located outside Ajmer city approx 7 kilometers from the city and on the main national highway 8. Very Big place, the main temple with huge statue of lord Mahaveer swami and 23 further miniature temples of Tirthankara's lined up on the hill above

title: Nice Religious Place
review: Very Nice Jain Religious Place, huge temple, good food, very nice arrangement to stay here, must visit here you will definitely feel devotional.

title: Under Construction yet Beautiful !!!
review: On the National Highway 7 KM north of the city of Ajmer, we have extremely beautiful site where Nareli Jain Temples are under construction.

title: Must visit temple if near ajmer
review: The temple is made in a very huge area of land. well maintained. Been there many times. a place worth seeing.

title: mix of traditional and contemporary architectural style
review: This temple is mix of traditional and contemporary architectural style.the temple is situated on the aravali mountain range.very beautiful temple must to go

title: Trip with brother and sister in laws
review: Amazing place. On the national Highway off Ajmer city. Beautiful Jain temple on the foot hills. Best time to visit During rainy season. Nice room A/C non Ac. The only problem is availability of good food. But if you can manage with Jain food then there is no issue.

title: Nice Jain Temple
review: Its a very nice temple with the typical jain style of intricate carvings all over the temple. Beautiful architecture. Nice experience and a good place for taking pictures. Worth a visit.

title: Marvelous
review: Though it is a modern temple mrans built recently but it dont look so scuplture and architecture is marvelous all walls have manuscripts from jain religion so beautifully written lavish gardens backside mountains add to its beauty place worth visiting

title: Serene.
review: This is temple on a huge piece of well designed landscaping. There is quite a walk from the gate to the temple. It is huge, well kept and  a place you would like to sit down and spend some time.

title: Serene and pristine
review: This was one of the best temples I have seen. It is prisitine and clean. The design is absolutely symmetrical. The large prayer hall holding only one single sculpture will touch yu deeply. There is no entrance fees. It also does not have rituals and other noise making activities as far as I can see. It is breathtakingly beautiful.I understand that there are staying arrangements.A day's stay would have been great, but I couldn't make it happen.

title: Well maintained, clean, peaceful religious place
review: Must visit place. Enjoy the beautiful modern architecture and very well maintained gardens. Kids will have a nice time here. Good for photographs. Ample parking space, conveniently located on the highway. However, food is not allowed inside.

title: Good temple but far
review: This temple is far if you are on the way to Jodhpur

title: Best place @ Ajmer
review: This is the best attraction @ ajmer. U must visit this place if u r in ajmer. Great place. Its around 10/11 km away from ajmer city. If u have any quarry dont hesitate to ask me.

title: New and beautiful
review: It is a very new, clean and spacious temple. There are plenty of trees and beautiful landscaped gardens surrounding the temple. It seems that the temple has not be inaugurated officially, hence the main door is closed. This can be misleading and one may return assuming the temple is closed, however it is possible to go up to the first floor and access the sanctum (there is a door there with a curtain and the staff will lead you via this)

title: Away from City Chaos
review: The place is about 10-15km away from the City. Very well made and maintained temple. Worth spending a day here.

title: Nareli Jain Temple - Refreshing Visit
review: The place just calms your senses, Relaxes your mind, De-stresses your mood.

title: Must visit place
review: This is the place where you can calm your mind, de-stress yourself and relax your senses. You will feel calm environment with spiritual energy. This is jain temple but you can also go there for picnic mood.
